poem:
### The Hack

Dialtones whisper behind closed doors,  
Thumbs and screens in clandestine groove,  
Syrupy secrets in honeyed choir,  
Wires sing stories of lives removed.  
Headlines crafted from stolen breaths,  
Morals falter in ink-stained halls.  
Yet words must stand against the tide,  
Where truth in silence always calls.
